definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: In comparison with the Americans, Chinese are more sensitive about their face.
sentences.chinese: 和美国人相比，中国人非常重视他们的脸面。

sentences.english: With the waiting depot, the arriving coffin, and the somber faces.
sentences.chinese: 这里是停柩所，是已运到的棺木，和无数阴沉的脸面。

sentences.english: He stayed in the hospital for half a year and returned home with a ruined face and a crippled leg.
sentences.chinese: 他在医院里呆了半年，回家时，脸面已毁，腿也跛了。

sentences.english: In spite of his face, which also allow for the kids, with him.
sentences.chinese: 不顾自己的脸面，也该顾及一下孩子们吧，随他去。

sentences.english: He dropped the gold down the chimney to save face for the impoverished father.
sentences.chinese: 他将黄金扔进烟囱以保留这位穷困的父亲的脸面。

sentences.english: Tears brim over with tears, tears falling on my face.
sentences.chinese: 泪水夺眶而出，长泪落在了我的脸面。

sentences.english: And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground, and I became dumb.
sentences.chinese: 他向我这样说，我就脸面朝地，哑口无声。

sentences.english: Person if be forced matchless place, the square knows that the face didn't exist magnitude.
sentences.chinese: 人若是被逼到绝处，方知脸面并没有生存重要。

sentences.english: HIV Death life, but also did not face his family.
sentences.chinese: 染上艾滋命归天，还要家人没脸面。

sentences.english: His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.
sentences.chinese: 脸面明亮如日头，衣裳洁白如光。

definition: feelings and sensibilities/sentiment and face/sensitivity to other's feelings
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
ashamed/embarrassed/not having the face (to meet people)/not daring (out of shame)
lining/(fig.) substance (as opposed to outward appearance)
self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen
lit. having face/to have prestige/to command respect/to have the nerve (e.g. to ask sth outrageous)/to have the gall/not ashamed to
to be put on the spot/to find oneself in an awkward situation
